newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka 1997 inflation seen at 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka 1997 inflation seen at 10 pct.

text.p: Sri Lanka's annual average inflation as measured by the consumer price index is seen lower at 10 percent this year against 15.9 percent in 1996, the Central Bank deputy governor said on Thursday.
S. Easparathasan told Reuters in an interview that the inflationary pressures of 1996 had not yet been seen in the first quarter of this year.

The Central Bank said in its annual report released on Wednesday that annual average inflation in 1996 was 15.9 percent, sharply up from 7.7 percent in the previous year, mostly because of a rise in food prices due to an increase in international wheat prices.
